page.title: netPanzer - An Online Multiplayer Tactical Warfare Game

subsection.title: Binary
subsection.p: This is the first netPanzer release that runs under GNU/Linux, it should also be compilable under Win32 with Mingw, see below for informations on how to obtain the source code. The binary does not depend on non-standard libraries, so it should be useable on most GNU/Linux systems out of the box.

subsubsection.title: Debian
subsubsection.p:
If you're using Debian unstable (Sid), you can add the following lines to your /etc/apt/sources.list file:
deb http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main contrib non-free
deb-src http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main contrib non-free
Second line is needed only if you intend to download sources of packages. After this modification you should run as root apt-get update and then apt-get install netpanzer.
Debian packages provided by Bartosz Fenski aka fEnIo fenio@o2.pl

subsection.title: Source Code
subsection.p: You need both the gamedata and the source if you want to compile yourself, in addition you need Jam, PhysicsFS, SDL, SDL_net, SDL_mixer and SDL_image, see the README for details.
Older releases and other files are available via the Berlios's Filelist.

subsubsection.title: CVS
subsubsection.p: Source Code is also available via CVS. Look at the netpanzer cvs page for details.
